Module CommonData
Package blocks

Class Blocks

java.lang.Object
blocks.Blocks
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<XYZBlock>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrayBlocks, OctTreeBlocks
public abstract class Blocks extends Object implements Iterable<XYZBlock>
This class is used to store minecraft blocks in an area defined by the width, length, height minX, minY and minZ values. The class contains a collection of helper function for common queries about the blocks, for example, the number of blocks with a specific classification in a subarea.
This abstract class does NOT define how the blocks are stored.

Most methods have two versions. One that uses the XYZBlock class and the other with just coordinates. XYZBlock is just a wrapper class for the coordinates + the block at those coordinates

The coordinates start from zero. One corner is (0,0,0) and another (width-1, length-1, height-1)

  • Constructor Details

    • Blocks

      public Blocks(int width, int length, int height, int minX, int minY, int minZ)
      Parameters:
      width - Width of the area
      length - Length of the area
      height - Height of the area
      minX - The smallest x-coordinate in the area.
      minY - The smallest y-coordinate in the area.
      minZ - The smallest z-coordinate in the area.

  • Method Details

    • inRange

      public boolean inRange(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns true if the coordinate is inside the area.
      Parameters:
      x - value in the range of 0-width is inside the area
      y - value in the range of 0-length is inside the area
      z - value in the range of 0-height is inside the area
      Returns:
      if the coordinate is inside the area

    • set

      public abstract boolean set(int x, int y, int z, Block block)
      Sets a block at a coordinate. The blocks should not be null! See remove(int, int, int)
      Parameters:
      x - x
      y - y
      z - z
      block - the block
      Returns:
      if setting the block was successful. Returns false when out of bounds

    • neighborsCount

      public int neighborsCount(int x, int y, int z)
      Counts the number of blocks touching the block at x,y,z. Maximum value is 6 (cube has 6 sides). Does not count air blocks (null blocks).
      Parameters:
      x - x
      y - y
      z - z
      Returns:
      the number of blocks

    • neighborsCount

      public int neighborsCount(XYZBlock XYZBlock)

    • numberOfNeighboringBlocksWithClassification

      public int numberOfNeighboringBlocksWithClassification(int x, int y, int z, Classification classification)
      Returns the number of blocks touching the block at the coordinate x,y,z that have the given classification. Maximum value is 6.
      Parameters:
      x - x
      y - y
      z - z
      classification - classification to match
      Returns:
      the number of blocks

    • numberOfNeighboringBlocksWithClassification

      public int numberOfNeighboringBlocksWithClassification(XYZBlock XYZBlock, Classification classification)

    • numberOfBlocksWithClassificationInRadius

      public int numberOfBlocksWithClassificationInRadius(int x, int y, int z, Classification classification, int radius)
      Returns the number of blocks that have the given classification in a radius. For example, a radius of three checks all blocks in a 7*7*7 cube with the specified coordinate as the middle.
      Parameters:
      x - x
      y - y
      z - z
      classification - classification to match
      radius - the radius
      Returns:
      number of blocks

    • numberOfBlocksWithClassificationInRadius

      public int numberOfBlocksWithClassificationInRadius(XYZBlock XYZBlock, Classification classification, int radius)

    • neighborsList

      public List<XYZBlock> neighborsList(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns the blocks that touch the block at x,y,z as a list of XYZBlock. The list has a maximum of 6 elements.
      Parameters:
      x - x
      y - y
      z - z
      Returns:
      list containing the items

    • neighborsList

      public List<XYZBlock> neighborsList(XYZBlock XYZBlock)

    • xyNeighborsList

      public List<XYZBlock> xyNeighborsList(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns the blocks that touch the block at x,y,z in the x and y directions as a list of XYZBlock. The list has a maximum of 4 elements.
      Parameters:
      x - x
      y - y
      z - z
      Returns:
      list containing the items

    • xyNeighborsList

      public List<XYZBlock> xyNeighborsList(XYZBlock XYZBlock)

    • getGroundLayer

      public GroundLayer getGroundLayer()
      Returns a GroundLayer built from the data. The ground layer object requires that at every (x,y) column there must be a ground block (no null values). So one must make sure that this object satisfies that requirement
      Returns:
      GroundLayer
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the ground layer cannot be built

    • getGroundLayerIncomplete

      public XYZBlock[][] getGroundLayerIncomplete()
      Finds the highest ground block Classification.GROUND in each (x,y) column. However, the 2d array may contain null values if the column does not have any ground blocks. Use getGroundLayer() to get a GroundLayer object that is guaranteed to have a ground block in every column.
      Returns:
      The x,y array that contains the XYZBlock representing the highest ground block

    • forEach

      public void forEach(Blocks.BlockAction action)
      Runs the action on every block in the area. The blocks will not be processed in any specific order
      Parameters:
      action - action

    • getBlockData

      public Blocks.BlockData getBlockData()
      Returns an Blocks.BlockData object that represents the data. The format of the Blocks.BlockData mimics the format of .schematic files that some minecraft editors use.
      Returns:
      the data
      See Also:
      • Schematic format

    • size

      public abstract int size()
      Returns:
      the number of blocks stored. Can be used to compare the memory usage of different implementations.
